definition: popular feeling/the will of the people
to enter deeply into people's hearts/to have a real impact on the people (idiom)
not to enjoy popular support/to be unpopular
to penetrate deeply into the heart (idiom)/to gladden the heart/to refresh the mind
that which is yearned for by the public
to stir up public sentiment by false statements (idiom)/to resort to demagogy
the men of today are sadly degenerated (idiom)
hard to fathom a person's mind (idiom)
there is no knowing what is in a man's heart (idiom)
a man who is never content is like a snake trying to swallow an elephant (idiom)
pinyin: ren2 xin1 bu4 zu2 she2 tun1 xiang4

definition: sapodilla, a tropical fruit bearing tree
to annoy people/to be a pain in the neck

sentences.english: The point of our pacification operations was always described as "winning the hearts and minds" of the people.
sentences.chinese: 我們綏靖行動的意義過去一貫被描寫爲“深得人心。”

sentences.english: The mayor is so popular that he has the whole town under his thumb.
sentences.chinese: 市長如此深得人心，全城人都聽他的。

sentences.english: Reunification of China today is consonant with popular sentiment and the general trend of development.
sentences.chinese: 今天，實現中國的統一，是人心所向，大勢所趨。

sentences.english: Mediation priority, early prevention, public power dominant the social security are essential Countermeasure.
sentences.chinese: 讓公權力主導社會安全的理念深入人心是基本對策。

sentences.english: Traveling is unarguably one of the most gratifying experiences a person can have in their lifetime.
sentences.chinese: 旅遊無疑是人一生中的一個最振奮人心的經歷之一。

sentences.english: In Japan, the brand, Zojirushi, which represents comfort has been impressed on everyone.
sentences.chinese: 在日本，這個代表着舒適的象印商標已深入人心。

sentences.english: The picture is more compelling with an arrow at this point.
sentences.chinese: 在這裏這張圖中的箭頭是扣人心絃的。

sentences.english: When the film became very exciting, Tom and Sally would hold their breath.
sentences.chinese: 電影演到激動人心處時，湯姆和薩莉就會屏住呼吸。

sentences.english: You can certainly gain popularity; however, don't do it by paying for everyone else.
sentences.chinese: 毫無疑問能夠獲得聲望，但是，不要靠收買人心得來。

sentences.english: The Eastern Sayan has a breathtaking landscape .
sentences.chinese: 東部的Sayan有着攝人心魄的風景。

sentences.english: Few men have had such transcendental capacity to stir the heart of people.
sentences.chinese: 很少人有如此超羣出衆的打動人心的才能。

sentences.english: But What shall people to do about the broken marriage, the demoralization ?
sentences.chinese: 但是什麼將要做的人們關於殘破的婚姻，敗壞人心？

sentences.english: This vision who can see people straight face?
sentences.chinese: 誰有這眼力能從面部直看到人心？

sentences.english: Sample an enormous amount of creative work and you’ll produce an inspirational concoction.
sentences.chinese: 體驗大量創新的作品，你會熬出鼓舞人心的藥汁。

sentences.english: In his heart a man plans his course, but the Lord determines his steps.
sentences.chinese: 人心籌算自己的道路，惟耶和華指引他的腳步。

sentences.english: Man's heart is not without joy even for one day.

definition: human nature/humanity/human/the totality of human attributes
affairs of life/things of the world
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
